titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Terry Tempest Williams Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:38

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, including manuscripts and proofs, journals, notebooks, day books, research files, photographs, printed materials, awards, artwork, and audiovisual materials related to the life and work of Terry Tempest Williams.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Ken Lopez Bookseller on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2011.
March 2013 Acquisition: gift of Terry Tempest Williams, 2013.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Materials in Series I. Papers Prior to 2002 were previously on deposit at the J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 153-154, 156, 357-359, 362: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Boxes 360-361: Restricted until January 1, 2037. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Boxes 161-162, 354-356 (audiovisual materials): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Terry Tempest Williams Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Terry Tempest Williams Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Materials formerly on deposit at the Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah, were processed to a greater level of detail prior to receipt at the Beinecke Libary.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Terry Tempest Williams
bioghist.p: Terry Tempest Williams is an American writer, poet, naturalist, and environmental and social activist. Her writings link environmental causes with social justice and women's health, art, politics, and spirituality.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, including manuscripts and proofs, journals, notebooks, day books, research files, photographs, printed materials, awards, artwork, and audiovisual materials related to the life and work of Terry Tempest Williams.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: Series I. Papers Prior to 2002; Series II. Papers Chiefly After 2002; and March 2013 Acquisition.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These materials were previously on deposit at the J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: These papers were processed while on deposit at the J. Williard Marriott Library at the University of Utah. To the extent possible the arrangement, including box and folder numbers, was kept as received. Folder titles were not verified against the contents of each folder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Roughly organized into the following groupings: Writings, Journals and Notebooks, Correspondence, Subject files and Miscellaneous papers, Photographs, Printed materials, Awards, Arwork and objects, Audiovisual materials, Restricted fragile, and Restricted papers. Because the papers received minimal arrangement below the box level, various types of materials can be found in multiple categories.
